meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Bill Pawlak Joshua Kosman Mark Lowenthal Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #872.

td.p: Bill Pawlak, an auditor from Rancho Palos Verdes, California
Joshua Kosman, a music critic originally from Haverford, Pennsylvania
Mark Lowenthal, a State Department employee from Reston, Virginia (whose 4-day cash winnings total $45,501)

tr.td: WESTERN SONGS
INDIANS
HAITI
PROVERBS
FOOD & DRINK

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'In the chorus that begins "Whoop-ee ti yi yo", they\'re told to "git along"')

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_4_4', 'clue_J_4_4_stuck', '(Joshua: Can\'t get it, sorry.)
(Alex: [*] by The Essex.)
[The song was not played going into the break.]

"Easier Said Than Done"

Joshua
')
div.onmouseout:
toggle('clue_J_4_4', 'clue_J_4_4_stuck', 'Proverbial title of the following, a number 1 hit in 1963:

"My friends all tell me /
Go to him, run to him /
Say sweet lovely things to him /
And tell him, he\'s the one /
Deep in my heart I know it /
But it\'s so hard to show it /
Cause it\'s easier, easier said than done /
My buddies tell me..."')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td:
Proverbial title of the following, a number 1 hit in 1963:
"My friends all tell me /
Go to him, run to him /
Say sweet lovely things to him /
And tell him, he's the one /
Deep in my heart I know it /
But it's so hard to show it /
Cause it's easier, easier said than done /
My buddies tell me..."

5-day champion: $49,901 + Jeopardy! box game
2nd place: Silent Thunder limited edition serigraph by Eyvind Earle from Robert Bane Editions & Smart Start lighting + Jeopardy! box game
3rd place: Emerson VHS recorder + Jeopardy! box game
Mark
Joshua
Bill

20 R,
8 W
(including 1 DD)

15 R,
4 W
(including 2 DDs)

4 W

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
